content.webTitle: Gordon Brown says wife his 'hero' after daughter's death

fields.headline: Gordon Brown says wife his 'hero' after daughter's death
fields.bodyText: Gordon Brown yesterday hailed his wife Sarah as his "hero", and praised the "quiet, dignified" way in which she coped with the death of their first child Jennifer. The prime minister told the Evening Standard how his wife had helped him deal with the tragedy. He said that Jennifer's death, aged just 10 days in 2002, had changed his life and he still constantly thinks about what his daughter – who would now have been eight – would be doing if she had survived. His experience changed the way he deals with bereaved people, including the families of soldiers killed in Afghanistan, he added.
